p: Effects of the main active EO compounds in SA, including trans-Caryophyllene, δ-Cadinene, α-Cadinol, or T-Muurolol, on rumen fermentation are unknown. The α-Cadinol and T-Muurolol in SA are also found in the EO of other medicinal plants, such as Alphinia zerumbet (shell ginger) and Neolitsea fischeri [ 27, 28], but those studies have focused on antibacterial and antioxidant effects. In general, all of the major active compounds in IN and SA have been reported to inhibit pathogenic bacteria, such as Bacillus cereus, Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli, Pseudomonas flourescens, and Listeria monocytogenes [ 28, 29].
